The truth about ALMOND CROISSANTSğŸ¥

Croissants go stale so quickly!! So hereâ€™s what you can do when you have a few extra ones laying around :) Or if you donâ€™t want to pay the almond croissant premium LOL.

âœ¨Ingredients:
â€¢1 cup water
â€¢1/3 cup sugar

â€¢4 croissants
â€¢25 gr unsalted butter
â€¢60 gr cane sugar
â€¢60 gr almond flour
â€¢1 medium egg
â€¢1 tsp vanilla extract
â€¢sliced almonds
â€¢powder sugar for dusting

In a small saucepan, bring water and 1/3 cup of sugar to a boil to make a syrup. Cool down. Preheat oven 350Â°F and cut croissants in half. In a bowl, combine softened unsalted butter with sugar. Then add almond flour, combine, and lastly add egg and vanilla to form an almost paste. Brush sugar syrup on the inside and outside of the croissant and then spread the almond paste inside. Close the croissant and spread more paste on top and top off with sliced almonds. Bake for 15-18 mins, cool down, and dust with powdered sugar. Enjoy!

EASY SPICY TUNA POKE BOWLSğŸŸğŸ¥£ğŸŒ¶ï¸ (full recipe below)

I think spicy tuna bowls are the new hot girl meal. I know raw fish can be a little intimidating, so make sure you buy previously flash-frozen fish from a grocer that you trust! I buy my ahi tuna filets from @Sprouts and eat them the day of.

âœ¨Ingredients (4 servings) // about 60gr protein per portion 

-1 1/2 lbs raw ahi tuna (2 steaks)
-1 1/2 tbsp sriracha
-2-3 tbsp aminos or soy sauce
-3 tbsp Kewpie mayonnaise
-1 cup edamame
-1 hass avocado
-1 cup uncooked sushi rice
-1 tbsp mirin
-1 tbsp rice vinegar
-1/2 tbsp sesame oil
-1 tsp salt
-1 tsp sesame seeds

Pat dry ahi tuna and cut it into 1-inch cubes. Place inside a bowl and add sriracha, aminos, and mayo. Stir until combined, cover, and rest refrigerated for at least 15 minutes. Cook sushi rice according to the instructions on the package. Warm up frozen edamame by pouring boiling water on top and letting it sit for 5 minutes. Slice avocado or mash it; feel free to season it however you like. Add mirin, rice vinegar, sesame oil, and salt to cooked rice. Stir and use it as a base for your bowl. Continue plating by adding about 4 ounces of tuna, 1/4 cup of edamame, and 1/4-1/2 an avocado. Portions are up to you! Top with sesame seeds, and feel free to add any extra sauce and seasonings like furikake. Enjoy immediately and save any leftovers in a tight-lid container in the fridge. Eat the same day.
